results.title: The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari
results.brief_description: The Cabinet of Dr Caligari is considered one of the very first horror movies, featuring an unreliable narrator and establishing horror movie tropes and styles. It’s the story of a mad hypnotist using a sleep-walker to terrorise a small town. Or is it?

constellations_other.name: Monsters, murder and mystery
constellations_other.description: Murder and mystery hide in the shadows born from German Expressionism.

results.description: Francis, a young man, recalls in his memory the horrible experiences he and his fiancée Jane recently went through. It is the annual fair in Holstenwall. Francis and his friend Alan visit The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari, an exhibit where the mysterious doctor shows the somnambulist Cesare, and awakens him for some moments from his death-like sleep. When Alan asks Cesare about his future, Cesare answers that he will die before dawn. The next morning Alan is found dead. Francis suspects Cesare of being the murderer, and starts spying on him and Dr. Caligari.
description_for_label: Francis, a young man, recalls in his memory the horrible experiences he and his fiancée Jane recently went through. It is the annual fair in Holstenwall. Francis and his friend Alan visit The Cabinet of Dr. Caligari, an exhibit where the mysterious doctor shows the somnambulist Cesare, and awakens him for some moments from his death-like sleep. When Alan asks Cesare about his future, Cesare answers that he will die before dawn. The next morning Alan is found dead. Francis suspects Cesare of being the murderer, and starts spying on him and Dr. Caligari.

results.title: The Cabinet of Dr Caligari [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Robert Wiene, Erich Pommer and Delca-Bioscop
results.brief_description: With psychosis, paranoia and the blurring of the distinction between madness and sanity at its centre, Caligari can be seen thematically as a distant forerunner to the psycho-horror sub genre. A sinister hypnotist, Dr. Caligari, exhibits his creature, a somnambulist named Cesare, at the town fair. When a series of bizarre murders follow, Dr. Caligari is accused of using the somnambulist to commit the murders. A silent masterpiece, “The Cabinet of Dr Caligari” features macabre theatrical-style set designs influenced by German Expressionism. The intention of the filmmakers was to expand the notion of cinema beyond its quest for re-creation of reality. These elaborate and haunting sets serve as a touchstone for the characters’ inner turmoil. This version features the original colourisation with green, brown and blue tints. Cast includes Werner Krauss, Conrad Veidt, Friedrich Feher, Lil Dagover, Rudolf Lettinger.

results.creator_credit: Robert Wiene, Erich Pommer and Decla-Bioscop

A series of bizarre murders follows and Dr. Caligari is accused of using the somnambulist to commit the murders. Features macabre theatrical-style set designs influenced by German Expressionism.

results.title: The Cabin Kids in Pink lemonade
results.creator_credit: Al Christie and Educational Films Corp of America
results.brief_description: Five Afro-American children of varying ages known as the Cabin Kids find they haven’t enough money to get into the circus. They decide to follow a dog under the side canvas but unfortunately are spotted by the police. However, Toto the Clown comes to their rescue only on the proviso that if the Cabin Kids entertain him, he will entertain them. The Kids sing in fine unison - and the clowns put on an impromptu act in return. Story by Al jarrett. Photography by George Webber.

results.title: The Cabin in the cotton
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, First National Pictures and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: A tenant share-cropper is befriended by a southern plantation owner. He finds himself torn between loyalty to his class and an obligation to their enemy who is also his benefactor. Cast includes Richard Barthelmess, Dorothy Jordan, Bette Davis, hardie Albright, David Landau. Based on the novel by Harry Harrison Kroll.

results.title: The Cabbage butterfly
results.brief_description: The life cycle of the cabbage butterfly is shown. The adult lays the eggs on the underside of the cabbage leaf, the eggs hatch and progress through five larval stages. Time-lapse photography follows the emergence of the butterfly from the chrysalis. Suggests methods of keeping the various stages in observance jars. English commentary, captions in Japanese. Credits in Japanese.

results.title: The Cabbage-Patch Fairy
results.brief_description: La Fée aux Choux (The Cabbage-Patch Fairy) is considered the first fictional film with a scripted narrative. It was created by trailblazing French filmmaker Alice Guy-Blaché, who returned to the story numerous time early in her career.

constellations_other.name: Cautionary tales and magic lantern projectors
constellations_other.description: Early magic lantern projections depicted cautionary religious scenes and fairytales, just like cinema did in its infancy.

constellations_other.name: Lost and found
constellations_other.description: Blossoming from Alice Guy Blaché’s The Cabbage-Patch Fairy, this Constellation explores the impermanence and enduring nature of the moving image.

results.description: La Fée aux Choux (The Cabbage Fairy, 1896) is considered the first fictional film with a scripted narrative. It was created by trailblazing French filmmaker Alice Guy-Blaché. It’s a brief fantasy tale involving a strange fairy who can produce and deliver babies coming out of cabbages, like the classic fairy tale. Some think The Cabbage-Patch Fairy is a lost film, but it’s so similar to Guy Blaché’s later works, others believe it never existed.
description_for_label: La Fée aux Choux (The Cabbage Fairy, 1896) is considered the first fictional film with a scripted narrative. It was created by trailblazing French filmmaker Alice Guy-Blaché. It’s a brief fantasy tale involving a strange fairy who can produce and deliver babies coming out of cabbages, like the classic fairy tale. Some think The Cabbage-Patch Fairy is a lost film, but it’s so similar to Guy Blaché’s later works, others believe it never existed.

results.title: The Byzantine Empire [B&W]
results.brief_description: The Byzantine Empire had become, by 750 AD, the richest and most powerful in the world. This film presents a brief historical outline of the Empire, and indicates its important cultural contributions in art, religion and scholarship. Photographed principally in Greece and Turkey, the film captures the richness of the mosaic works, icons and architecture. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: The Buzz of rock and roll
results.creator_credit: Dale Lynch and Victorian College of the Arts, School of Film and Television
results.brief_description: Documentary about three Australian musicians who are also tinnitus sufferers- Fiona Horne (DefFX), Rod Ling (July Fourteenth) and Richard Pleasance (Boom Crash Opera). Tinnitus is a condition that causes ringing in the ears and affects one in five people.
